comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I always wondered (since watching Popeye cartoons) whether those "funnels" are for sucking fresh air in, or for blowing stale air out? Or for putting Popeye in?

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The combustion air for the boiler furnace gets drawn down these ventilators. The products of combustion go up the funnel.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Thanks!  Presumably they swivel to catch the breeze.

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Picture of SS Conningbeg leaving Waterford port. City is on starboard side (right in picture). Various funnels are for the ships ventilation system. Hard to believe that my grandfather Thomas who went down with this ship in December 1917 leaving a wife and NINE children, would have walked this deck. Thanks for publishing it.

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: Possibly The Lizard docked at top right?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] Very sad! Whatever happened your grandmother and the nine children?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: She reared the nine, seven boys and two girls.Report of the loss of the ship arrived in Waterford Christmas eve 1917. Hard to imagine that. Family: One to USA, one to Australia, seven at home. All found work or married, had families. All now deceased. Great bunch of people. Will try and upload photo of herself. I never knew her.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] Thanks for sharing your stories.  It is emotional to look at photos connected with ancestors -  you wonder what might have been different if ... .  My own Irish grandfather was mercifully only wounded in WW1,  otherwise I would not exist.  So if my comments above about Popeye etc seem flippant or insensitive,  I apologize.

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] Great Family Story you have completed some very interesting  research. Not many families of nine in Ireland today!!. If your grandfather had survived the family would probably have been much bigger.

I love the story about the two Insurance Companies fighting over the cause of the loss, some things will never change!!!

Do you know if your Grandmother received the pension which was mentioned in one post?

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all for nice comments and no offence was taken Beachcomber. I believe that my grandmother did receive the appropriate widow's pension. I have uploaded a photo of her with my father on my stream and also a photo of the monument in Waterford to those lost on the SS Conningbeg and Formby in Dec 1917. It is on the quays in Waterford city almost at the point where the ships used to dock
